ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Thurgadim hunting?
ygData.messageBody:
Not that I recall.

Lago

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cyr, Thierry [SMTP:thierry.cyr@...]
> Sent: Monday, January 08, 2001 9:09 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Thurgadim hunting?
>
> so i assume no factions in icewell?
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mott, Mike J. [mailto:mike.j.mott@...]
> Sent: December 27, 2000 10:10 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Thurgadim hunting?
>
>
> Icewell Keep is pretty rough. Certain creatures in there are unmezzable
> (frost spikes...at least our chanter couldnt) and if you lose a corpse
> deep
> in (such as when a creature flees, party doesnt zone and someone gets
> summoned and killed) you are in for a long CR. I was in a group with a
> lvl
> 58 cleric, lvl 54 necro, 56 warrior, 53 bard (me), 54 enchanter and 51
> shaman and we could handle ONE frost spike at a time...two and we were
> dead.
> Everything we fought in there hit for 180+. Alot of the crushed gems for
> the Thurgadin quests dropped for us, as well as the new Cleric|necro
> improved invis to undead spell.
>
> The same group went to Chardok the next day and it felt like a walk in the
> park compared to the keep.
>
> Lago Bardoon of Bertox
> 53 Minstrel
> Guild Leader, Defenders of Aleria
>
>
> > anyone hunt in Thurgadim? I was lost in there other night and came upon
> a
> > curve where i saw a bat on the other side, it conned blue to me at 42
> and
> > ready to attack where as all the dwarves were amiable to me. So i guess
> > there's a mini dungeon in there. Anyone try it out yet?
> >
> > And for that matter anyone try icewell keep yet? i zoned in by accident,
> > hit
> > tracking and everything on track was red to me except for 1 sentry which
> > was
> > blue.
> >
> > Minkin 42 bard
> >
> >
> >
> >
> > Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
> > with the subject submissions.
> >
>
>
> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
> with the subject submissions.

> Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
> with the subject submissions.
